front.title: End-to-end QoS provisioning mechanism for Differentiated Services

abstract.t: This document presents an end-to-end mechanism to guarantee bandwidth and delay into the Differentiated Services mechanism to constant rate traffic such as voice and video. The mechanism requires network routers to be able to serve packets according to three classes of priority. The needed call admission control is performed by an end- to-end signaling procedure that implicitly looks for the required bandwidth and seizes it, if available. Short delays are guaranteed by the regular structure of constant rate traffic. No entities other than source and destination are involved and multicast operation comes at no further cost, which makes the mechanism fully scalable and integrable into the existing Internet.
